p.codeblock: public abstract int startCameraCapture( Constants.VideoSourceType sourceType, CameraCapturerConfiguration config);
public abstract startCameraCapture( sourceType: Constants.VideoSourceType, config: CameraCapturerConfiguration): number;
virtual int startCameraCapture(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, const CameraCapturerConfiguration& config) = 0;
UFUNCTION(BlueprintCallable, Category = "Agora|IRtcEngine") int StartCameraCapture(EVIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, const FCameraCapturerConfiguration& config);
public abstract int StartCameraCapture(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, CameraCapturerConfiguration config);

section.title: Details
section.p: You can call this method to start capturing video from one or more cameras by specifying sourceType.

note.props: ios cpp unreal bp unity rn flutter

section.note: On the iOS platform, if you want to enable multi-camera capture, you need to call and set enabled to before calling this method.

pd.p: The type of the video source. See .

li.props: ios cpp unreal bp flutter unity rn

ul.li: On iOS devices, you can capture video from up to 2 cameras, provided the device has multiple cameras or supports external cameras.

li.props: android cpp unreal bp flutter unity rn

ul.li: On Android devices, you can capture video from up to 4 cameras, provided the device has multiple cameras or supports external cameras.

li.props: mac cpp unreal bp flutter unity cs electron

ul.li: On the desktop platforms, you can capture video from up to 4 cameras.

pd.p: The configuration of the video capture. See .

note.props: ios cpp unreal bp unity rn flutter

pd.note: On the iOS platform, this parameter has no practical function. Use the config parameter in instead to set the video capture configuration.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.props: native unreal bp electron unity cs rn
ul.li: < 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
